guitar

Class Wire

  • java.lang.Object
    • guitar.Wire

  • public class Wire
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to control the wire, where the tension is being stored, fret numbers and actually vibrating the cable to create the noise.
    Author:
    brandonandre

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wire(int tension)
      Constructor that sets the default tension when instance is created.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeTension(int deltaTension)
      Changes the tension based on it's current position.
      void fret(int fretNum)
      Method that changes the fret number for the specific wire that the class is attached too.
      void pluck()
      By plucking the wire attached to the instance, it will in turn vibrate the wire creating the noise.
      void vibrate()
      Vibrate the wire to produce the sound effect.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wire

        public Wire(int tension)
        Constructor that sets the default tension when instance is created.
        Parameters:
        tension - default tension when the instance is created.

    • Method Detail

      • vibrate

        public void vibrate()
        Vibrate the wire to produce the sound effect.

      • pluck

        public void pluck()
        By plucking the wire attached to the instance, it will in turn vibrate the wire creating the noise.
        See Also:
        vibrate

      • fret

        public void fret(int fretNum)
        Method that changes the fret number for the specific wire that the class is attached too. Note that it sets the fret number, not delta.
        Parameters:
        fretNum - Amount you want to set the fret to. Cannot be a negative integer.

      • changeTension

        public void changeTension(int deltaTension)
        Changes the tension based on it's current position. Changing the tension creates a different pitch, so when its vibrated it creates a different noise.
        Parameters:
        deltaTension - Based on it's current value, it changes the tension up or down.
